intro: Centropogon cinereus f. odontosepalus, commonly known as the gray centropogon with toothed sepals, is a rare horticultural form of the centropogon genus. It is characterized by its distinctive, toothed sepals that set it apart from the typical smooth-sepal variety. The plant belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is native to specific regions in South America. It typically features lance-shaped leaves and produces showy, tubular flowers in shades of pink or purple. Due to its unique morphology, it is highly sought after by plant enthusiasts and botanists alike.
